summary: Code initializes x as an integer, checks if it is of type int using isinstance(), and prints the result. Then it assigns string "hair" to z and checks if it is of type int, which it is not. Finally, it runs a for loop that checks each element in range(100) if it is of type int and prints only integers (which are all the elements from 0 to 99). The comment "i think you are shit" has no relevance to the code functionality and can be disregarded.

details.content:
x=int(2)
y=isinstance(x,type(x))
print(y)
z="hair"
print(isinstance(z,type(x)))
for x in range(100):#  i think you are shit.

        print(x)
